title: Qualifications for membership

content.text: Subject to the provisions of article 54 of this Constitution, a person shall be qualified to be elected as a member of the House of Representatives if, and shall not be qualified to be so elected unless -
(a) he is a citizen of Malta;
(b) he has attained the age of eighteen years;
(c) he is registered as a voter for the election of members of the House of Representatives;
(d) he is not disqualified for election as a member of the House of Representatives by or under any law for the time being in force in Malta; and
(e) he is qualified to be registered as a voter for the election of members of the House of Representatives.

amendmentHistory.description: Amendment lowering qualification age from 21 to 18 years

notes: This article establishes the qualifications required for membership in the House of Representatives, including citizenship, age, and voter registration requirements.
